meanings.definition: A person or thing that tugs.
meanings.sent1: The little tugger pulled the wagon with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The tugger at the front of the train helped move the heavy load.
meanings.sent3: The tugger in the tug-of-war competition was surprisingly strong.
meanings.sent4: She was a tugger of hearts, effortlessly drawing people towards her.
meanings.sent5: The determined tugger never gave up, always pulling through challenges.

meanings.definition: A machine or vehicle used for towing or pulling heavy loads.
meanings.sent1: The tugger on the construction site moved the large crates effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse used a tugger to transport heavy pallets around.
meanings.sent3: The automated tugger had a mind of its own, zipping around the warehouse.
meanings.sent4: The tugger on the farm worked tirelessly, pulling equipment across the fields.
meanings.sent5: The tugger's engine roared as it hauled the massive load behind it.
